summary: DOD's more than 73,000 enlisted medical personnel serve in roles ranging from paramedics to imaging technicians, and must be ready to use their wartime medical skills to care for injured and ill servicemembers. However, DOD could do more to define, track, and assess wartime medical skills. For example, the Army does not consistently track skills training in its official system, and none of the services...
title: Defense Health Care: Actions Needed to Define and Sustain Wartime Medical Skills for Enlisted Personnel
